page.title: 14Recreation.
page.content: The Yelverton Golf Club was established in 1904 when there were only nine holes and a wooden hut. By 1911 there were eighteen holes, and by 1925 the present club house had been built. Today there are some 500 members. Non members are charged a fee of Â£9.50 per round and the use of changing facilities. Horse riding over Roborough Down is much enjoyed. Many people come to sit, picnic, or walk on the down and enjoy the moorland scenery and the sight of the ponies and sheep grazing. Litter from these visitors can be a problem to the animals and sometimes causes fires. Each summer term children from th Tavistock Comprehensive School work with a ranger to clear some of the rubbish.
